snippet: Small but significant declines in childhood obesity offer the first indication that one of the nation’s most intractable health problems may be reversing course.
abstract: Report by Robert Wood Johnson Foundation finds that several American cities are seeing their first declines in childhood obesity rates; declines are small but significant because they offer signs that obesity epidemic, one of the nation’s most intractable health problems, may be reversing course.
lead_paragraph: Small but significant declines in childhood obesity offer the first indication that one of the nation’s most intractable health problems may be reversing course.

headline.seo: Rate of Childhood Obesity Falls in Several Cities
headline.main: Obesity in Young Is Seen as Falling in Several Cities
headline.print_headline: Obesity In Young Is Seen As Falling In Several Cities
